meanings.sent1: She was taken aback by the unexpected news.
meanings.sent2: I was aback when I saw the magician make the rabbit disappear.
meanings.sent3: The puppy looked aback when the cat suddenly jumped out from behind the couch.
meanings.sent4: His bold statement left everyone aback in the meeting.
meanings.sent5: The loud thunder took me aback as I walked home in the storm.

meanings.definition: In a position with the sails pressed back against the mast by the wind.
meanings.sent1: The ship's crew quickly adjusted the sails when they noticed they were aback.
meanings.sent2: The boat struggled to move forward with the sails aback.
meanings.sent3: The sailboat looked funny with its sails aback in the calm harbor.
meanings.sent4: The yacht raced with the wind, never allowing the sails to be aback.
meanings.sent5: The old pirate ship creaked as the wind pushed the sails aback.
